derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: probably via Middle Dutch from Old French grenat, from medieval Latin granatus, perhaps from granatum (see pomegranate), because the garnet is similar in colour to the pulp of the fruit

entry.tran: 石榴石（用于珠宝制作，有红、黄、绿等颜色）
entry.def: A garnet is a hard, shiny stone that is used in making jewellery. Garnets can be red, yellow, or green in colour.

means.word_mean: 1. any of a group of hard glassy minerals (silicates of various metals) used as gemstones and as an abrasive
